originalText.text: Wouldnâ€™t recommend taking an apartment here, maintenance never fixes anything you can put countless amounts of tickets they seem to just ignore it and the problem continues.. also the apartments are small like really small, whatever you do when you decide to move here donâ€™t mail your rent they will tell you they never got it, i can keep going but save your self

originalText.text:
Did anyone else got selected with this fraud of an development just to be informed by outside agency that because of LEAD no one can move into the apartments until the whole building gets fixed?
Management and all employees are aware of this, but choose to lie and take in people's applications anyway to help them stay in business.
And even after I was informed I will not be moving into East River Houses and everything was exposed, management and his employees refused to place my application back on the wait-list so that another NYCHA development can select me.

Here are some news articles that I found of other tenants at East River Houses who filed lawsuits due to unhealthy living conditions MOLD, NO HOT WATER, Severe LEAD POISONING.

June 4, 2023- "Health Department let East River Houses cover up lead paint hazards even after child was hospitalized : lawsuit"
October 17, 2022- "NYCHA ticket repair times are through the roof. East River Houses resident S.P. pictured October 7, has been dealing with mold, chipped paint and lead in her Harlem apartment"

originalText.text: This park has come a long way.. few years ago this park was a reck .. it wasn't a place for kids to go and play.. but.. now they did a awesome job. And is more active with positivity.. before then I say no one will chill there unless you was up to no good... Pretty good clean up. Pretty good come back..
